title: dropbox: case insensitivity causes duplicated files
body:
I'm trying to sync Dropbox to my local machine (Linux) with rclone -v -n sync dropbox:/ ~/data

```
$ rclone -v -n sync dropbox:/ ~/data 2>&1 | grep -i Console2
2015/05/03 22:48:14 tools/Console2/Console.exe: Not copying as --dry-run       
2015/05/03 22:48:14 tools/Console2/console.chm: Not copying as --dry-run       
2015/05/03 22:48:14 tools/Console2/FreeImage.dll: Not copying as --dry-run     
2015/05/03 22:48:14 tools/Console2/ConsoleHook.dll: Not copying as --dry-run   
2015/05/03 22:48:14 tools/Console2/FreeImagePlus.dll: Not copying as --dry-run 
2015/05/03 22:48:14 tools/Console2/console.xml: Not copying as --dry-run       
2015/05/03 22:48:28 Tools/Console2/console.chm: Not deleting as --dry-run      
2015/05/03 22:48:29 Tools/Console2/ConsoleHook.dll: Not deleting as --dry-run  
2015/05/03 22:48:29 Tools/Console2/FreeImagePlus.dll: Not deleting as --dry-run
2015/05/03 22:48:29 Tools/Console2/FreeImage.dll: Not deleting as --dry-run    
2015/05/03 22:48:29 Tools/Console2/console.xml: Not deleting as --dry-run      
2015/05/03 22:48:29 Tools/Console2/Console.exe: Not deleting as --dry-run      
```

while

```
$ rclone lsd dropbox:/
[...]
           0 0001-01-01 00:00:00        -1 Tools
[...]

$ rclone lsd dropbox:/Tools
[...]
           0 0001-01-01 00:00:00        -1 Console2
[...]

$ ls -la ~/data
[...]
drwxrwxrwx 18 dropboxbackup dropboxbackup       19 May  1 17:57 Tools
[...]
```

Looks like some case problem.

Thank you!
